title: Chale Wote Street Art Festival
description: Ghana's most vibrant street art festival, celebrating art, music, dance, and performance in the historic Jamestown neighborhood of Accra. A must-see for lovers of contemporary African culture.
cost: Mostly Free, some events may require tickets.
insiderTip: The festival gets very crowded, especially on the weekend. Visit on a weekday for a more relaxed experience. Wear comfortable shoes and stay hydrated.

title: Homowo Festival
description: The annual festival of the Ga people, celebrated to 'hoot at hunger.' It involves traditional rituals, processions, and the sprinkling of the special meal 'Kpokpoi.'
cost: Free to observe, but be respectful of rituals.
insiderTip: The main celebrations and processions typically happen on Saturdays. Ask for permission before taking photos of chiefs or traditional ceremonies.

title: Asa Baako - One Dance
description: An eco-friendly music and arts festival held in Busua, Western Region. It features a mix of Afro-house, funk, soul, and local Ghanaian music on the beach.
insiderTip: Book accommodation in Busua or the nearby town of Dixcove well in advance, as places fill up quickly. It's a great opportunity to take surfing lessons.
